p: In a theoretical approach, Fogg et al. [ 20] used molecular dynamics to rationalize the structures of LiAl-X (Br −, Cl −, NO 3 −, CO 3 2−, SO 4 2−, C 2O 4 2−) and showed that this approach is a useful predictive tool for simulating interlayer spacings and the orientations of the guest ions in the related intercalates. The density functional theory (DFT) calculations were performed to study the structural stability of LiAl-X (X = F −, Cl −, Br −, OH −, NO 3 −, CO 3 2−, SO 4 2−) and also the CO 2 capture capacity of LiAl-X (X = Cl −, NO 3 −, CO 3 2−) [ 21]. In a later study, Cl − position changes were observed in LiAl-Cl by molecular dynamics simulation between −90 and 90 °C [ 22].
